articles.title: Mars Rover Discovers Ancient Water Evidence
articles.description: NASA's Perseverance rover has found compelling evidence of ancient water flows on Mars, suggesting the planet may have once supported microbial life.

articles.title: James Webb Telescope Captures Distant Galaxy
articles.description: The James Webb Space Telescope has captured stunning images of a galaxy formed just 300 million years after the Big Bang, providing insights into early universe formation.

articles.title: International Space Station Celebrates 25 Years
articles.description: The ISS marks a quarter-century of continuous human presence in space, with over 3,000 scientific experiments conducted aboard the orbital laboratory.

articles.title: Artemis Mission Updates: Moon Base Progress
articles.description: NASA announces significant progress in the Artemis program, with plans to establish a sustainable lunar base by 2028 moving forward on schedule.

articles.title: New Exoplanet Discovery in Habitable Zone
articles.description: Astronomers have identified a potentially habitable exoplanet orbiting a nearby star, with conditions that could support liquid water on its surface.

articles.title: ESA's Mars Express Finds New Ice Deposits
articles.description: The European Space Agency's Mars Express orbiter has discovered significant underground ice deposits near Mars' equator, opening new possibilities for future missions.

articles.title: SpaceX Starship Successfully Reaches Orbit
articles.description: SpaceX achieves a major milestone as Starship completes its first successful orbital flight, paving the way for future deep space missions.

articles.title: China's Lunar Base Construction Begins
articles.description: CNSA announces the beginning of construction for a permanent lunar research station, partnering with Russia and other international partners.
